intro: Lessertia mucronata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low shrub, with compact growth habit and dense foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
